title: How to Draw a Bathroom Sink

steps.headline: Draw a half-circle to make the body of the sink.
steps.description: The flat part should be facing upwards, as seen, with the rounded section arcing towards the ground.

steps.headline: Draw two ovals, one horizontal and the other vertical.
steps.description: Both should be centered and on top of the lower part of the body.

steps.headline: Make the top of the sink.
steps.description: Draw two ovals, one inside the other.

steps.headline: Draw four rounded rectangles for the spout and handles.
steps.description: There should be a long one aligned to the center of the sink, a smaller one on top of it, and finally two short ones to the left and right of the first.

steps.headline: Draw two vertical ovals connecting the handles to the sink.
Use silver or gold when you color the handles and spout.
steps.description: The sink bowl can be any color.

text: Draw a half-circle to make the body of the sink. The flat part should be facing upwards, as seen, with the rounded section arcing towards the ground. Draw two ovals, one horizontal and the other vertical. Both should be centered and on top of the lower part of the body. Make the top of the sink. Draw two ovals, one inside the other. Draw four rounded rectangles for the spout and handles. There should be a long one aligned to the center of the sink, a smaller one on top of it, and finally two short ones to the left and right of the first. Draw two vertical ovals connecting the handles to the sink.  Use silver or gold when you color the handles and spout. The sink bowl can be any color.
